content.description: Crimpy climbing to a bouldery crux mid route, then to a nice rest and one more tough move before the chains.
content.location: Left of Cedar Poke

content.description:
This thing is a classic with awesome moves on incredible features.  

  Figure out the boulder problem down low and then take a sit down, no hands rest on the route's namesake "sodomizing" feature. The route eases up half way, but don't let that fool you, something this classic can't give up that easily.
content.location: Right of Estrella Oscura

content.description: Shorter route with boulder start with crimps to flat undercling by first bolt and ambiguous jug haul finish. Decent route but not a first pick.
content.location: Camouflaged in the midst of the other lesser mid-5.12's in the middle of Lizard Wall. You tend to pass it by unnoticed due to watching your footing as you walk near it. Look for Maurice Corner and then go one route left.

content.description: Fun moves up vertical to slightly overhanging rock.
Pretty wet
content.location: Second to last bolted line on Lizard Wall. Just after the last rain shielding roof above.

content.description:
Don't let the name fool you - this is a quality route! Enjoy the steep face climbing on crimpers and long moves to jugs. Save some mojo for the top! 

  This climb ends just below the roof. If you are feeling froggy, there is a two-bolt extension through the roof named Decay (12d). Beware though, the anchors for the extension were extremely rusted April 2017.
content.location: Left of Grey Streak.

content.description: Move through first 3 bolts on crimps and sidepulls to good shake on huge jug left of 4th bolt. Traverse right to interesting clip, then fire through sustained crimps to final bolt and eventual jugs at the chains.
content.location: Three routes left of Dark Star.

content.description: Description and Beta: Quick couple moves to deep dirty horizontal under small roof. Reach through large sidepulls to a couple tiny crimps with bad feet crux. Find a way to get to big dirty edges above. Mostly cruising with a few hard moves after. Try not to throw rocks down as you take advantage of a good rest. Make an easy mantle to the anchor. Requires bouldering ability at crux.
content.location: 8th bolted route or so. 2nd to the right of Lemonade

content.description: Standard lizard wall pulling through the first 4/5 bolts with a side pull crux. Then the hard stuff. Bouldery, techy, and maybe slightly slimey depending on when you climb it. Good till the very end!
content.location: Right of short doug

content.description: Route starts in a shallow right facing corner and climbs through juggy featuresÂ with good rests. Get a good shake before the roof where a few different options to pull the lip are found, then take the easy jug hauling to the top
Great moves separated by good rests on vertical stone capped by a roof. Classic!
content.protection: 10 bolts some with permadraws to anchors.

content.description:
This is a good warm-up for the other routes at this wall.  

  Make it through the tricky start and once better established on the face, enjoy the sustained overhung climbing on jugs.
Probably hardest at the start, then mostly good holds for majority of the route, with another challenging section near the top.
content.location: Second route from the right

content.description: Start with left facing corner to good rest. Follow jugs to crux near top.
content.location: Middle of Lizard wall, one left of Agent Orange, Long Doug, Robyn's Route.

content.description:
Boulder through the start to get a decent rest just below the roof. Pull the roof boulder problem to get another, better rest before fighting the pump to the chains. 

  This route is also known as Recedes.
content.protection: 5 bolts + anchors. The last ten feet or so of this climb is heads up but relatively easy climbing.
content.location: Right of Crazy Fingers, left of Estrella Oscura.

content.description: Starts with small right facing sidepull corner, often seeps. Route has a handful of crimpy boulder cruxes with hard pulling separated by great rest holds.
content.location: About the middle of Lizard wall, 4th bolted line left of Robyn's Route not counting link ups.

content.description: Patter up the start to a shelf. Continue up on crimps to a finish that'll keep you on your toes.
content.location: Just right of Rotten Pillar.

content.description: Climb Permatorque, get it back, and bust out roof on fun boulder problem. Finishes on cold shuts.
content.location: Extension to Permatorque

content.description: Tricky crimpy opening sequence (crux) leads to ledge rest above 3rd bolt. From here, sustained 5.11 climbing on ledges and crimps takes you past some sandy rock to the chains.
First 3 bolts of Short Doug, then traverse left to  Robin's routes (4th bolt) at its crux and continue left to reach the 5th bolt of Long Doug. Finish on Long Doug
content.protection: 9 or 10 bolts, a few currently fixed, shuts anchors

content.description: The crux is pulling a small roof about half way up, but most people will probably fall from the increasingly small holds near the top. Plenty of rests to be found on this climb, though, so there's no excuse.
content.location: Just to the left of the small roof and corner.

content.description: Climb Rotten Pillar and continue past anchors to reachy but good holds through roof.
content.location: Near-Middle of Lizard wall. Above Rotten Pillar, left of lemonade.

content.description: Usually wet
content.location: Last bolted line on Lizard wall. After the last roof sheltering the other routes.

content.description:
After clipping the first bolt of Rotten Pillar, trend left through sidepulls and crimps, making your way to better holds that lead you to the anchors.  

  Careful of the flake system at the top to the left of the anchors - they are likely to break off.
content.location: shares the same start and first bolt as Rotten Pillar.

content.description: Figure out the boulder problem at the roof down low, and then pull jugs to a rest at the fourth bolt. Another boulder problem on a series of sloper crimps gets you to the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 anchors. The bolting on this is heads up. There is a runout from bolt two to bolt three, and a fall at bolt three could be bad.

content.description: Fun route, but hard for the grade. A low crux packs a punch and then it's consistent pulling to the chains.
content.location: On the right side of the wall, just to the left of Stella Blue a bit to the right of a tree that's near the wall.Â

content.description: The crux is at the first bolt and is probably harder for shorties. If you make it through the crux, your reward is a jug haul to the chains.
content.location: Third route on the wall.

content.description: Follow ledges and crimps to long move at 4th bolt. Shake out and trend right and then up through runout section on jugs to next good shake. Proceed up, pull mini-roof (crux) and continue on sustained crimps to anchors.
content.location: Pass about 30 routes and follow narrow 5ft trail down to more routes near end of wall. This is the second route after the short downward trail ends, and the 4th route from the end.

content.description: Piece together the puzzle between the first and second bolt. Unlock the sequence and then fight the pump on edges to the anchors.
content.location: This is the route just left of Lemonade.

content.description: A hard move at bolt two leads to some enjoyable 5.11 climbing and a great rest topped by a heart breaker crux up top.Â
content.location: Just to the left of cardboard cowboy. This is the third to the last route on the wall, although it might as well be the last since the last two routes are almost always wet.Â

content.description: Stick clip 1. Figure out the boulder problem at the first bolt and go up much more enjoyable climbing to the top. Except it feels like a squeeze job. I found myself almost on Lemonade and the climb to the right. Holds were really sandy and a bit chossy. There's probably a more direct line but it doesn't make sense. Choose your own adventure on this one!
content.location: The bolted line right of Lemonade.

content.description: A mellow start, a crimpy middle, and a reachy finish.
content.protection: 5 bolts and anchors. (shares anchors with Bon Voyage)
content.location: Left of Bon Voyage.

content.description: Boulder first portion and continue leaning right to orange streak.
content.location: MIddle of Lizard wall. Second route left of Robyn's Route.

content.description:
This is the perfect rainy day wall featuring steep faces on perfect southern sandstone.  

  Dogs are difficult to get to this wall, as there is a tricky 15ft down climb to navigate.
